definition: rickshaw seat (Beijing dialect)/patron (of teahouse, cinema)/passenger (in taxi, rickshaw etc)
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
the north-facing room opposite the master's in a siheyuan 四合院[si4 he2 yuan4]
erhua variant of 散座[san3 zuo4]/single seat (in theater)/irregular passenger (in rickshaw)
erhua variant of 碑座[bei1 zuo4]

sentences.english: Thank you, but we'd like the main dining hall.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢，不过我们想要在大厅的座儿。

sentences.english: A youngster stood up and offered his seat to the old lady.
sentences.chinese: 有一个小伙子起来给老太太让了个座儿。

sentences.english: The Box will serve for a seat.

definition: erhua variant of 旁邊|旁边[pang2 bian1]
by the window (referring to seats on a plane etc)
to sit at a table with others with whom one is unacquainted
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/proximity/thread (of ideas, plots etc)/see also 邊|边[bian1]
to give up one's seat/to be seated
